edu.cnm.deepdive.montyhall

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.montyhall.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    the Game class establishes the fields that are used to determine how the game works, whether you have won or lost and updates the corresponding tallies based on your decisions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()

      the method takes whatever door was selected and determines whether it was a car or a goat.

      the method determines whether the door is in the open or closed state.

      this method places the contents on the stage.

      this method gives you the success rate when you stay with your original door choice.

      this method gives you the success rate when you switch your original door choice.
      boolean isDoorSelected(int i)
      this method determines whether the door is selected.
      boolean isWin()
      the method determines whether the final door you selected has a car or a goat in it thus determining whether you have won or lost.
      void resetTally()
      this method allows you to reset the tally for won_stayed, won_switched, total_switched and total_stayed.
      void selectedDoor(int i)
      the method states that if we are at the beginning and the first door is selected then either door 2 or door 3 is revealed.
      void setup()
      the setup method takes the Contains method and assigns a goat or a car to a door and shuffles them around so that they are not the same each turn.
      void stayDoor()
      the method allows you keep your original door selection.
      void switchDoors()
      the method allows you the ability to switch to a different door than the one you originally selected as long as that door is still closed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
        the setup method takes the Contains method and assigns a goat or a car to a door and shuffles them around so that they are not the same each turn. This is done at the of each turn.

      • behindDoor

        public edu.cnm.deepdive.montyhall.Door.Contains behindDoor(int i)
        the method takes whatever door was selected and determines whether it was a car or a goat.

      • doorState

        public edu.cnm.deepdive.montyhall.Door.State doorState(int i)
        the method determines whether the door is in the open or closed state.
        Parameters:
        i - i
        Returns:
        returns the door open or closed.

      • selectedDoor

        public void selectedDoor(int i)
        the method states that if we are at the beginning and the first door is selected then either door 2 or door 3 is revealed. If door 3 is chosen then it will reveal either door 1 or door 2. if door 2 is chosen then either door 3 or door 1 is revealed. at the end of this method you will have chosen one of 3 doors and another will have been revealed to you as a goat.
        Parameters:
        i -

      • switchDoors

        public void switchDoors()
        the method allows you the ability to switch to a different door than the one you originally selected as long as that door is still closed. If you switch doors and win then the won_switched tally will be updated.

      • stayDoor

        public void stayDoor()
        the method allows you keep your original door selection. If you win then the won_stayed tally will be updated.

      • resetTally

        public void resetTally()
        this method allows you to reset the tally for won_stayed, won_switched, total_switched and total_stayed.

      • getSwitchSuccessRate

        public double getSwitchSuccessRate()
        this method gives you the success rate when you switch your original door choice. If you switch then regardless of whether you win or lose the total_switched tally will be updated. If you also win and switch then the won_switched tally will be updated as well.
        Returns:
        a new tally.

      • getStaySuccessRate

        public double getStaySuccessRate()
        this method gives you the success rate when you stay with your original door choice. If you stay then regardless of whether you win or lose the total_stayed tally will be updated. If you also win and stay then the won_stayed tally will be updated as well.
        Returns:
        a new tally.

      • getStage

        public edu.cnm.deepdive.montyhall.Game.Stage getStage()
        this method places the contents on the stage.
        Returns:
        stage state.

      • isDoorSelected

        public boolean isDoorSelected(int i)
        this method determines whether the door is selected.
        Parameters:
        i - boolean
        Returns:
        true, if the door you are looking at is the chosen door.

      • isWin

        public boolean isWin()
        the method determines whether the final door you selected has a car or a goat in it thus determining whether you have won or lost.
        Returns:
        true if car || return false if goat.
